column1: Art Institute of Chicago////As a fan of impressionist paintings
column2: I found myself inspecting every stroke and color used by Monet
column4: and Renoir.  The Van Gogh exhibits were fascinating to see too.  Don't ignore the architecture of the entire facility! It's gorgeous. Point being
column5: give yourself ample amount of time to go through the 3+ floors that this museum has to offer.  A casual fan can whiz through this exhibit in less than an hour and a half
column6: but a more involved person would take about 2.5-3 hours.  Hunger can be a huge distraction so make sure to eat before or bring a clean snack.  Employees see any crumbs dropping on the floor
